description: WAAF is committed to battling HIV/AIDS, TB, and other conditions through grassroot initiatives throughout communities. The main objectives for WAAF are to deliver prevention, behavioral, care and support services for the general population but with emphasis on vulnerable populations. Our ultimate goal is a future where HIV and AIDS is no longer an epidemic, and people are no longer stigmatized. The organization’s vision and mission guide for daily and long-term operations, as detailed in the organization’s strategic plan document.

description: Akatsi South Municipal Hospital was established as a dental clinic in 1996. It was upgraded to a health center in 1996. It was again upgraded to a district hospital in 2007 and further upgraded to Municipal status in the year 2021. Our mission is to provide compassionate holistic health-care to promote healing, foster innovation and empower our diverse community to achieve optimal well-being. Services rendered include mental health, maternal & child health, out-patient (OPD) services, inpatient services, laboratory services, pharmacy & dispensary services, ART and public health services. Specialized units include Dental, ENT and Eye. The recent additions include Diabetes/Hypertension (DM/HPT) clinic, wellness clinic, breast and cervical screening units.

procedure: ["Provides obstetric deliveries in the delivery and lying-in ward","Offers In-Vitro Fertilization (IVF) procedures at an IVF Unit","Provides cosmetic and reconstructive surgical procedures","Performs general surgical procedures through the Surgery department"]

capability: ["Located at JPRQ+HX Accra, Tantra Hill, Accra","Has 87 French and Ghanaian medical professionals available 24/7","Emergency services operate 24/7","Overall bed capacity of 39 beds (VIP and common wards)","Three paediatric wards (including one VIP) in the paediatric section","Delivery ward and lying-in ward","In-Vitro Fertilization (IVF) Unit","NHIS and other private insurance clients welcome","Departments include Medical & Emergency; Surgery; Cosmetic & Reconstructive Surgery; Paediatrics; Dentistry; Ophthalmology; Fertility & IVF Center; Gynaeco-Obstetric; Clinical Laboratory","Urologist on staff","Physiotherapist; Optometrists; Dentists available"]
description: Ghana's finest French-English hospital. Our medical team consists of 87 French and Ghanaian medical professionals who are at your service 24/7, with French-English bilingual co-founders, a consultant surgeon and a paediatrician. The hospital consists of a team of general practitioners, surgeons & anaesthetists, paediatricians, gynaecologists, an urologist, a physiotherapist, optometrists, dentists, midwives and nurses. It disposes of two operating theatres with a recovery room, an IVF unit, three children’s wards (including one VIP) in the paediatric section, VIP and common wards with an overall capacity of thirty-nine beds, a delivery and lying-in ward, a well-equipped standard laboratory, medical imaging services (Ultrasound & ECG), and a treatment room. NHIS and other private insurance clients are welcome; Ghanaians and foreigners benefit from the same rates.

name: Bechem Government Hospital
procedure: ["No specific clinical procedures listed in provided content."]
equipment: ["Phototherapy machine donated to Bechem Government Hospital in May 2016","Dental chair donated to Bechem Government Hospital in May 2016"]
capability: ["Bechem Government Hospital has a bed capacity of 155.","Operates as a district (secondary) hospital within the Ghana Health Service in the Tano South District, Ahafo Region.","Not-for-profit facility.","Serves as a referral hospital for all sub-district health facilities.","Average daily attendance is around 366 patients.","Contracted NHIA provider for the Tano South District Health Insurance Scheme (TSDHIS).","Provides 24-hour service.","Originally established as a Maternity Home in 1950 and handed over to the Ministry of Health on 1 July 1978 as a Health Centre; presently operating as a District (Secondary) Hospital."]
description: The Bechem Government Hospital was started by the Presbyterian Church, Ghana, as a Maternity Home in 1950 and handed over to the Bechem Community. It was finally handed over to the Ministry of Health on 1st July, 1978 as a Health Centre and currently operating as a District (Secondary) Hospital with 155 Bed Capacity.  The Hospital is a Secondary Ghana Health Service facility in the Tano South District of the Ahafo Region operating on not-for-profit basis. The Hospital serves as a Referral Hospital for all sub-district health facilities with an average daily attendance hovering around 366 patients.  The Hospital serves as the main health facility contracted for the provision of health services to clients of the Tano South District Health Insurance Scheme (TSDHIS) of the National Health Insurance Authority (NHIA).  It is the intention of the Facility to satisfy our numerous target groups, thus, patients, visitors to patients, corporate organizations, suppliers, its staff and employers of Ghana Health Service and Ministry of Health at large.  The Hospital also aims at inculcating into its staff the spirit of dedication and service to our customers/clients and to achieve a much satisfied clientele.  The Hospital has both Mission and Vision statements which are in line with the Ghana Health Service (GHS).

description: The idea for establishing the Ghana Cleft Foundation originated in 2005 from discussions among members of the Komfo Anokye Teaching Hospital Cleft Clinic. These discussions were informed by the firsthand experiences of the hardships faced by families of children born with cleft lip and palate. The Cleft Clinic attracts patients from all parts of the country, majority of whom are from low income backgrounds.

description: The Greater Accra Regional Hospital’s (GARH) core mandate is the delivery of curative, health promotion and preventive services in the region and sub region. Its services range in complexity from secondary to tertiary level care. The GARH also serves as a practical attachment site for numerous schools including the Accra College of Medicine. It is thus committed to creating an enabling environment in which education and research in the health science and allied areas thrive.

description: Integrated Diagnostic Solutions Ltd. began in 2013 as an ultramodern diagnostic centre in Ashaiman located on the first floor of Senaky Plaza Building. It currently operates in two regions in Ghana (the Greater Accra and Western Region), has seven affiliates at Ashaiman and Tema municipality and Takoradi. It can boast of state of the art equipment, capable of undertaking several laboratories investigations, ultrasound scan, Electrocardiogram, Mammogram and X-ray. I.D.S had always made quality its priority to become the leaders in diagnostics in Ghana and a center of research after the quest for International Organization for Standardization (ISO) accreditation. We believe in diagnostics as the essential tool in patient management, therefore, our facilities are manned by highly qualified, competent and experienced staffs who are capable of delivering excellent results and hence our motto: “if it’s there, we will find it…”

name: Le Mete NGO Ghana
procedure: ["Two operating theatres are completed and operational at the Tamale surgical center","The center performs general surgery and urology procedures","The two operating theatres support a high throughput of 35–40 surgical interventions per week","Maternal-infant department with 18 beds is part of the center's services"]
equipment: ["Two operating theatres equipped for general surgery and urology","Ward infrastructure includes sterilization room, septic rooms, recovery/awakening rooms, examination and dressing rooms, and a reception area"]
capability: ["Le Mete NGO Ghana owns a 4-hectare site donated by village chiefs of Nanton, registered as the property of Le Mete NGO Ghana","The center is integrated with the Tamale Teaching Hospital and operates under a co-ownership/management agreement with the University and the hospital","Led by Dr. Akis Afoko, who is president of Le Mete NGO Ghana","Population served by the center is estimated at 7 million","The project is supported by the Ghana Health Service and the Ministries of Education and Health","Estimated total project cost is 500,000 euros; Italy-based donations total 159,731 euros; Ghana-based donations total 120,000 euros; materials/equipment donations total around 110,000 euros","Phase status: Phase 1 and Phase 2 completed with two operating theatres; Phase 3 maternal-infant department with 18 beds; Phase 4 expansion completed; Phase 5 in progress to build additional wards, mortuary, auditorium and classrooms","The two operating theatres have supported 35–40 interventions per week","The project operates as part of the Tamale Teaching Hospital and collaborates with Ananase Project; Italian Embassy in Accra and Ghanaian Embassy in Rome support the project"]
organizationDescription: Le Mete NGO Ghana is a Ghana-based volunteer association involved in the development and operation of a general and urology surgical center in Tamale, in collaboration with the Ghana Health Service and the Tamale Teaching Hospital, led by Dr. Akis Afoko.

capability: ["Has a 100-bed capacity general hospital serving the Ledzokuku-Krowor area (Teshie and Nungua) and beyond","Eye center opened in 2013","Malaria Research Centre is part of Lekma Hospital","Herbal Medicine Unit is part of Lekma Hospital","22 doctors including 9 specialists","Over 200 nurses","Governmental facility funded by the Government of the People's Republic of China","Construction completed in 16 months and the hospital was inaugurated on 21 December 2010","Approximately 7.28 million USD provided by the Government of China","Adjacent Nursing and Health Assistant Training School collaborates with the hospital for practical training and internships","Located at PMB Teshie Area; Office Location: Tswuibleoo, Teshie, Accra","Website: http://www.lekmahospital.org; Email: lekmahospital@gmail.com and lekmahospital2@gmail.com; Phone: +233302717945","The hospital lacks equipment and especially IT devices for administrative work","Municipal hospital for the Ledzokuku-Krowor area (Teshie and Nungua) and beyond","Building was established with support from China and relies on private and foreign donors"]
address_line1: PMB Teshie Area – Office Location: Tswuibleoo, Teshie
description: The Lekma Hospital is a governmental health facility built by the Chinese Government in 2010 as a friendship hospital. It is a 100-bed capacity hospital with units including laboratory and radiological facilities, a Malaria Research Centre and a Herbal Medicine Unit. It serves as the municipal hospital for the Ledzokuku-Krowor (Teshie and Nungua) area and beyond. The hospital’s clinical staff includes 22 doctors (9 specialists) and over 200 nurses. It opened a special eye centre in 2013.

name: Methodist Faith Healing Hospital
capability: null
description: The Methodist Faith Healing Hospital (MFHH) is a 112-bed facility dedicated to providing quality and holistic care to communities in and around the Afigya Kwabre district in the Ashanti region, Ghana. The hospital was dedicated on September 24th 1988, and began as an out patient department (OPD) on March 25th 1991. Current services offered at MFHH include Maternity, Diagnostics (lab, X-ray and Scan), In-Patient Care, Surgery, Accident & Emergency, Public Health, Optometry and ENT (ear, nose & throat). The facility also serves as a referral hospital for two main districts within the Ashanti Region; Afigya Kwabre and Kwabre East. The hospital also manages eight other Methodist clinics spread across the Ashanti Region. Mission: Making Life whole by delivering holistic quality health care to humanity. Vision: The hospital seeks to become a center of medical excellence which will provide preventive, curative and rehabilitative services. The facility also seeks to provide teaching, training and research opportunity for health care personnel in the country.

name: Methodist Hospital, Wenchi
equipment: ["3 operating theatres","On-site X-Ray & Ultrasound facilities","Endoscope equipment"]
capability: ["On-site laboratory services","Three on-site pharmacies operate 24/7, with one dedicated to wards and the other to serve the OPD unit","Established in 1951","238-bed facility","Referral center for 19 health facilities within Wenchi Municipality, Tain and Banda Districts","Specialist services: Urology, Orthopedics, Dental, Eye","Special clinics: Hypertensive, Diabetic, ART, Sickle Cell","70+ years of operation","75 medical staff","300+ nurses","Located in Wenchi, Bono, Ghana"]
description: The Methodist Hospital was established in 1951 by the Chiefs and people of Wenchi. It started as a dressing station in a small room at the current location of the Police Station. It was transferred to its present site, also in 1951, when a single block of the local Methodist Middle School was released by the Methodist Church under the auspices of the then Superintendent Minister, the Rev. Captain (Rtd) John Dixon, who was instrumental in getting the people of Wenchi a Hospital. The Hospital has now grown to become a two hundred and thirty eight (238) bed facility which serves as a referral center for the 19 health facilities within Wenchi Municipality, Tain and Banda Districts. Read more...

name: Rophe Specialist Care
capability: ["Established in 2017.","Originally intended to be a comprehensive Diabetes & Endocrine center with endocrinologist/diabetologist, ophthalmologist, psychologist, nephrologist, and dietician.","Expanded to include pulmonologist, urologist, gynaecologist and dermatologist.","Aims to provide outpatient specialist care as a private health care facility in Accra, Ghana.","Mission emphasizes empowering patients to make informed health decisions in partnership with integrity and trust."]
description: Rophe Specialist Care was established in 2017, originally with the intention of being a comprehensive Diabetes & Endocrine center with a physician specialist, endocrinologist/diabetologist, ophthalmologist, psychologist, nephrologist, and dietician. Shortly after it’s inception, it was realized that we could serve our community better by offering other specialist services which were not available within this neighborhood hence the addition of other specialists including a pulmonologist, urologist, gynaecologist and dermatologist.

name: Shekhinah Clinic
procedure: ["Volunteer surgeon Dr Alhassan performs free surgeries on six patients per day on Tuesdays and Thursdays (first-come-first-served).","Dr Kirby performs free surgeries five days per week for a month or two, twice a year."]
capability: ["Shekhinah Clinic is a free clinic located in Tamale, Northern Region, Ghana, serving the poor and destitute.","Cares for approximately 60-75 patients daily in OPD and related services.","Approximately 30 new patients visit the OPD each day.","Provides free medications to 30+ patients per day when stock is available.","Offers a food program providing nutritional lunch to over 150 people in and around Tamale.","Operates as a volunteer-based clinic with visiting physicians including Dr Alhassan and Dr Kirby; Dr Kirby visits twice a year for a month or two and performs surgeries five days per week.","Consultations are handled by Mr Majeed and Mr Kwame; triaging and check-ins are performed by Ms Zulaigha and Ms Mufida."]
description: Shekhinah Clinic is a free clinic in Tamale, Northern Region, Ghana that caters to the poor and destitute. It also runs a food program providing nutritional lunch to over 150 natives in and around Tamale. Volunteers cater to 60-75 patients daily, with about 30 new patients; consultations are handled by Mr Majeed and Mr Kwame; triaging and check-ins by Ms Zulaigha and Ms Mufida; Dr Turner provides assistance as a retired physician; on Tuesdays and Thursdays a volunteer physician, Dr Alhassan from Tamale Teaching Hospital, performs free surgery on six patients per day; Dr Kirby has provided free surgeries for 20+ years, usually twice a year; the clinic provides free medication to 30+ patients daily.

description: St. Paul’s Dental Clinic not only meets your expectations regarding your dental experience, but also surpasses them. We are a team of dynamic people dedicated to making your dentist experience great on all fronts. We accomplish this through efficient teamwork, a gentle patient approach, and a sense of compassion and commitment. It is the combination of these qualities that makes us your most preferred dentist in the Sekondi – Takoradi area. Our doctors and professional staff are trained and focused on effective listening to help each patient articulate and obtain their desired results. We strongly recognize and advocate the role of other dentists and specialists in your treatment and fully endorse the 'team approach' to allow each professional to contribute his or her expertise for your maximum benefit.

name: SVG Africa
procedure: ["SVG Africa conducted surgeries during a health mission in the Kwahu Districts in March 2016."]
capability: ["SVG Africa conducts health missions in local hospitals and communities in Ghana.","SVG Africa partnered with The Helen Hodgkins Trust in January 2016 to initiate water and sanitation projects.","SVG Africa collaborated with the Ghana AIDS Commission for an HIV/AIDS prevention and awareness campaign in Easter 2013.","SVG Africa distributed 20 community water filters in July/August 2014, reaching about 4,000 people.","SVG Africa completed the construction of a toilet block for a large school in Aduamoah in August 2015."]
missionStatement:
SVG aims with its programs to provide social and functional networks that serve as meeting point for

those willing to participate as volunteers

institutions that are part of developing processes

and the communities which are part of these programmes

Our programmes take place in Ghana, a country that faces numerous challenges to its development: lack of or inadequate access to water and sanitation, poor infrastructures, low enrolment rates in secondary and tertiary educational institutions, high maternal/child mortality rates.

However, Ghana is also host to a large talented young population/ workforce, is rich in resources, has one of the highest GDP growth figures in all of Africa, and is destination for increasing numbers of investors/tourism.

Civil society organisations are key to fair and inclusive development processes; globalisation processes tend to target economic rather than social growth or wellbeing; this sows the path towards increasing inequalities within populations.

Sustainable development thus should tackle growth across board: all sectors of society, in both rural and urban spaces. It must do so respecting local culture, the environment, and trying to ensure future generations' needs are protected today. 

Our contribution to this is to provide or assist those already providing services in the areas of Education, Health and Water and Sanitation, using a participatory approach -working alongside local rural populations, in locally relevant projects.

description: The Tema Women’s Hospital provides services in obstetrics and gynaecology as well as general clinic for both in patient and out patient in a relaxed, caring and supportive environment. In 1999, Dr. Paul Owusu Baah, after working in Ghana for some years , realized the need for a fertility services in the hospital, hence the birth of the In Vitro fertilization (IVF) Unit. Since then, the unit has combined professinal care and meticulous laboratory techniques which has resulted in high pregnancy rates for couples who present with infertility problems.

capability: ["The Thyroid Ghana Foundation is a non-governmental organization focused on creating awareness of thyroid disorders in Ghana and providing treatment.","Its mission includes creating awareness of thyroid diseases in Ghana.","Its mission includes creating opportunities for early detection of thyroid problems.","Its mission includes supporting thyroid research and institutions involved in thyroid disease management.","Its mission includes providing access to affordable treatment and advocating for improved healthcare practices for thyroid disease patients in Ghana.","The foundation intends to develop a registry for all thyroid patients in the country starting from the Greater Accra region.","The foundation intends to build a thyroid care unit within Korle-Bu Teaching Hospital.","The foundation plans to develop supportive programmes and facilities for people affected by thyroid diseases.","Location: 112, Lane 10, Onyinase Street Awoshie, Accra.","Phone: 233 (024) 3376304.","Founder/President: Nana Adwoa Konadu Dsane.","Board Chair: Rev. Ayeh-Kumi.","Head of Operations: Mr. Leslie Chartey Kumahlor.","Public Relations Officer: Dr. Joyce Emefa Addo-Klah.","Consultant Dietician: Frank Anyimadu.","Research Coordinator: Justice Kwesi Baah.","Staff page dated 05.24.2018.","Has a social media presence on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.","Offers awareness events, partnership opportunities, and volunteering opportunities."]

description: The Trauma and Specialist Hospital, Winneba, is a specialized secondary referral health facility in the Central region located at Winneba in the Efutu Municipality. It serves as the last referral point for other Hospitals, Health centres and clinics in the Municipality and beyond. The catchment area is Efutu and surrounding Districts. The Hospital also receives patients from Ga South Municipality. Currently, the Hospital serves as the interim Central Regional Hospital. The Hospital is turnkey project where the design, build and equipping of the secondary referal hospital was undertaken by EN-Project(The Projects Division Of Enraf Nonius B.V.).
